conclusion: Particle A decelerates from t = t₀ to t = 3 t₀, speed falls from 2 v₀ to 0.
Magnitude of deceleration for Particle A: a_A = (2 v₀ – 0) / (3 t₀ – t₀) = v₀ / t₀.
Particle B decelerates from t = 5 t₀ to t = 6 t₀, speed falls from v₀ to 0.
Magnitude of deceleration for Particle B: a_B = (v₀ – 0) / (6 t₀ – 5 t₀) = v₀ / t₀.
Ratio of magnitudes of decelerations: a_A : a_B = (v₀ / t₀) : (v₀ / t₀) = 1 : 1.
